panels.description: This panel should show no activity in a stable cluster. Some leadership transition events are expected, such as during cluster upgrades. Unexpected events may indicate an issue with cluster stability
panels.title: Election Events

panels.description: Measures the time it took to write Raft log to disk
panels.title: Raft Dispatch Log

panels.description: This counts the number of Raft transactions occurring over the interval.
panels.title: Raft Apply Count

panels.description: This metric takes the time difference between when a message was first passed into Raft and when the resulting commit took place on the leader
panels.title: Raft Commit Time

panels.description: Ð ow long it takes a follower node to process newly received Raft logs from the leader.
panels.title: Raft Append Entries

panels.description: Measures the time since the leader was last able to contact the follower nodes when checking its leader lease
panels.title: Last Contacted

panels.description: Shows the time spent handling a domain queries for each node. A spike here may indicate that there are too many concurrent domain queries, or the catalog is under high contention.
panels.title: Domain Query Time

panels.description: Shows the rate of domain queries per node
panels.title: DNS Queries

panels.description: Show the time spent handling a reverse DNS query for the given node.
panels.title: Reverse Query Time

panels.description: Shows the rate of reverse DNS queries per node
panels.title: Reverse Queries

panels.description: Number of one-off RPC requests a server has handled
panels.title: RPC requests

panels.description:
Number of potentially blocking RPCs a server has received.
Blocking request  is a form of long polling in which a server will attempt to keep the connection open while waiting for changes in the requested data.
panels.title: RPC blocking

panels.description: Increments for each RPC between client and server nodes
panels.title: RPC client requests

panels.description: Increments when client RPC exceeds locally configured RPC limit
panels.title: RPC client exceeded

panels.description: Number of errors a Consul server has encountered while serving a one-off RPC request
panels.title: RPC errors

panels.description: Increments whenever a Consul agent in client mode makes an RPC request to a Consul server and fails.
panels.title: RPC client errors

panels.description: This measures the time it takes to complete an update to the KV store.
panels.title: KV Apply Time

panels.description: Show the rate of updates applied to the KV store.
panels.title: KV Apply Count

panels.description: This shows the rate of increase for catalog register and deregister operations.
panels.title: Catalog Operations

panels.description: Measures the time it takes to complete catalog register or deregister operations.
panels.title: Catalog Operation Time
